question: In men with SSRI-induced sexual dysfunction, does sildenafil improve erectile function compared with placebo? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Erectile function, arousal, ejaculation, orgasm, and overall satisfaction domain measures improved significantly in sildenafil compared with placebo patients.
content.source_2: Using a CGI-SF threshold of 2 or less, the proportion rated much or very much improved did not differ meaningfully: 6.8% (3/44) on sildenafil versus 9.1% (4/44) on placebo (P=.41).
content.source_3: Conclusion: In this randomized cohort of men with SSRI-related sexual dysfunction, sildenafil did not enhance erectile function or other sexual function domains relative to placebo, with outcomes remaining statistically indistinguishable between groups.
